basics.name: Christopher Blow France
basics.label: Design director, programmer, strategist
basics.summary: Hello, I’m Christopher. I am a designer, programmer and usability researcher. I’ve led large design contacts with companies like Sony, Facebook and Cambridge University, built products with companies like Meedan and The Data Guild, and founded my own companies. I lead digital product design process, usually in collaboration with business and engineering teams. I serve as a full-spectrum, cross-functional integrator who speaks technical, design and business-strategic languages. I also have deep experience as a behavioral usability researcher.

work.summary: LightField is using design and data strategy for regenerative agriculture, with a focus on innovation in financial products serving this sector. We are developing business partnerships around our data products with a goal of increasing the rate of regenerative transition through increased investment opportunities based on improved soil health.
highlights: Bootstrapping technology company

work.summary: At Healthmade I work to invent creative solutions to healthcare issues using web and mobile prototyping, UI design and data visualization. My focus is building tools to serve people living with chronic illness.
highlights: Created data visualizations
Designed algorithms used in display of healthcare data
Created full-stack mobile product

work.summary: At Contain I designed and built a fintech platform which algorithmically matches lenders and borrowers in contained agriculture, an emergent technique which uses approximately 10x less resources than conventional agriculture.
highlights: Created fintech platform

work.summary: Litterati is an environmental startup that uses crowdsourced data derived from local litter cleanup activity to create a large commercial dataset of consumer packaging data. I help with partnership and commercial strategy by designing and prototyping data refinement tools used by the team.
highlights: Developed data pipelines and data refinement process
Created data visualizations to guide analysis of packaging database

work.summary: As a lead member of our venture studio, I am responsible for a wide range activity in a data-intensive environment. I do partnerships, business process design, business development, hiring and client services. My focus is prototyping new technical capacity and creating production designs — from sketching and wireframing to JavaScript, pitch decks and business plans.
highlights: Developed research tools for evaluating social impact of startup concepts
Led product research and development for portfolio companies
Led a technical design, branding and profile effort for the Guild

work.summary: Meedan is a technology services company focused on translation and communication technology. Meedan has a goal to create more meaning in the world. Meedan works as a technology consultancy with large social networks such as Facebook. I operated the design process and all aspects of our user research strategy. I led the team responsible for graphic design, front-end code, design systems and strategies to support a product team creating new media projects.
highlights: Over ten years, I helped grow the company from a team of four people to a successful team on four continents.
Led large user research projects with clients such as Facebook and Cambridge University
I led the design of the Check platform, which was used for one of the world's largest journalistic collaborations
Developed style guides, and best practices as design manager responsible for global team

work.summary: I was responsible for designing studies, analyzing results, collaborating with clients. I created videos, wireframes and sketches. I helped design and build Ethnio, a digital product for the user experience industry.
highlights: Helped build Ethnio as a Rails developer
Managed research for clients such as Sony and Harvard Business Review
Expanded the company services to include design practice

work.summary: I revitalized a web consulting business with a user-centric voice. I implemented an Agile development methodology and the Rails stack.
highlights: Quadrupled sales in 6 months by winning clients such as Duke university and Burt's Bees
Reduced email spam by 90% by implemented greylisting
Managed successful development team transition from Perl to Ruby

work.summary: I developed applications for managing stakeholder data, creating educational surveys and gathering real-time feedback.
highlights: Developed PHP application for generating surveys
Developed web-based feedback tool for evaluation process
Developed Microsoft Access database for central storage of stakeholder data

work.summary: I operated a consultancy with clients such as Duke University and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
highlights: Designed and developed print material
Created logos and branding campaigns
Created interactive CDs for educational department

work.summary: I helped create a custom database for the Law Review, and I managed their website.
highlights: Created back-office database to optimize internal process.

volunteer.summary: Worked with Ushahidi, a crowdsourcing platform for crises.
highlights: Helped design the initial Ushahidi iPhone app
Helped designed multiple hosted instances concept, later funded as crowdmap.com
Design Swift, later funded as a multi-year project

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Asheville

awards.summary: A number of projects that I worked on have won awards recently, an Online Journalism Award (for Electionland, one of the largest journalistic collaborations in the U.S.), the International Press Institute News Innovation Contest, the Innovate Africa Innovation Challenge and the Knight News Challenge for Prototypes.

speaking.summary: In the last few years I’ve given a variety of presentations at events like RightsCon, Global Fact, the Online News Association, DrupalCon, the International CrisisMappers Conference, SXSW, the African News Innovation Challenge, the Nonprofit Technology Conference, the NYU Interactive Telecommunications Program and Stanford.
